refnamediv.refpurpose: popup window displaying information about an application (new in PyGTK 2.6)

refsect1.title: Ancestry
refsect1.synopsis: +-- gobject.GObject +-- gtk.Object +-- gtk.Widget +-- gtk.Container +-- gtk.Bin +-- gtk.Window +-- gtk.Dialog +--gtk.AboutDialog

row.entry: The list of people who have contributed artwork to the program. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The list of authors of the program. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
A string containing comments about the program. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
A string containing copyright information for the program. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The list of people documenting the program. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
A string containing the license of the program. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
A logo for the about box. If this is not set, it defaults to the default window icon list. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The name of an icon to use as the logo for the about box. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The name of the program. If this is not set, it defaults to g_get_application_name(). Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.12 and above.
Credits to the translators. This string should be marked as translatable. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
A string containing the version of the program. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The URL for the link to the website of the program. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The label for the link to the website of the program. If this is not set, it defaults to the URL. Default value: None. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
If True the license text should be wrapped. Default value: False. This property is available in GTK+ 2.6 and above.
The color of hyperlinks. This property is not available in GTK+ 2.10 and above.

refsect1.title: Description

note.para: This widget is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect1.para: The gtk.AboutDialog offers a simple way to display information about a program like its logo, name, copyright, website and license. It is also possible to give credits to the authors, documenters, translators and artists who have worked on the program. An about dialog is typically opened when the user selects the About option from the Help menu. All parts of the dialog are optional.

About dialog often contain links and email addresses. gtk.AboutDialog supports this by offering global hooks, which are called when the user clicks on a link or email address, see the gtk.about_dialog_set_email_hook() and gtk.about_dialog_set_url_hook() functions. Email addresses in the authors, documenters and artists properties are recognized by looking for <user@host>, URLs are recognized by looking for http://url, with url extending to the next space, tab or line break.

refsect1.title: Constructor

listitem.simpara: a new gtk.AboutDialog

note.para: This constructor is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect1.para: Creates a new gtk.AboutDialog with default property values.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_name

listitem.simpara: the program name.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

warning.para: This method is deprecated in PyGTK 2.12 and above and should not be used in newly-written code. Use the get_program_name() method instead.

refsect2.para: The get_name() method returns the program name displayed in the about dialog.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_name

listitem.simpara: a string containing the program name or None to use the default name.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

warning.para: This method is deprecated in PyGTK 2.12 and above and should not be used in newly-written code. Use the set_program_name() method instead.

refsect2.para: The set_name() method sets the name to display in the about dialog. If name is None, it defaults to g_get_application_name().

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_program_name

listitem.simpara: the program name.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_program_name() method returns the program name displayed in the about dialog.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_program_name

listitem.simpara: a string containing the program name or None to use the default name.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_program_name() method sets the name to display in the about dialog. If name is None, it defaults to g_get_application_name().

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_version

listitem.simpara: The version string or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_version() method returns the string contained in the "version" property.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_version

listitem.simpara: the version string or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_version() method sets the "version" property to the string in version.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_copyright

listitem.simpara: the copyright string or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_copyright() method returns the string contained in the "copyright" property.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_copyright

listitem.simpara: a string containing the copyright notice or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_copyright() method sets the "copyright" property to the string contained in copyright. If copyright is None, the copyright notice is hidden.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_comments

listitem.simpara: a string containing the comments or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_comments() method returns the string contained in the "comments" property.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_comments

listitem.simpara: a string containing the comments or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_comments() method sets the "comments" property to the string contained in comments. If comments is None the comments label is hidden.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_license

listitem.simpara: a string containing the license information or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_license() method returns the string contained in the "license" property.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_license

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_license() method sets the "license" property to the string contained in license. If license is None the license button is hidden.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_wrap_license

listitem.simpara: True if the license text should be wrapped

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.8 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_wrap_license() method returns the value of the "wrap-license" property. If "wrap-license" is True the license text should be automatically wrapped.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_wrap_license

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.8 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_wrap_license() method sets the "wrap-license" property to the value of wrap_license. If wrap_license is True the license text should be automatically wrapped.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_website

listitem.simpara: a string containing the website URL or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_website() method returns the string contained in the "website" property. The website should be a URL.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_website

listitem.simpara: a string containing the URL of the program's website or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_website() method sets the "website" property to the string contained in website. The string should be a valid URL.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_website_label

listitem.simpara: a string containing the website link label

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_website_label() method returns the contents of the "website_label" property. The website label is used if the url hook has been set using the gtk.about_dialog_set_url_hook() function.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_website_label

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_website_label() method sets the "website_label" property to the string contained in website_label if the url hook has been set using the gtk.about_dialog_set_url_hook() function.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_authors

listitem.simpara: a list containing the names of the program authors

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_authors() method returns the contents of the "authors" property. The "authors" property contains a list of the names of the authors of the program.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_authors

listitem.simpara: a list containing the names of the program authors.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_authors() method sets the "authors" property to the list contained in authors. The author names are displayed in the authors tab of the secondary credits dialog. set_authors() method will show the Credits button if it is not displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_documenters

listitem.simpara: a list of the program documenters

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_documenters() method returns the contents of the "documenters" property which contains a list of the names of the program documenters.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_documenters

listitem.simpara: a list of the names of the program documenters

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_documenters() method sets the "documenters" property to the contents of documenters. The documenter names are displayed in the documenters tab of the secondary credits dialog. set_documenters() method will show the Credits button if it is not displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_artists

listitem.simpara: a list of the names of the program artists

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_artists() method returns the contents of the "artists" property which contains a list of the names of the program artists.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_artists

listitem.simpara: a list of the names of the program artists

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_artists() method sets the "artists" property to the contents of artists. The artist names are displayed in the artists tab of the secondary credits dialog. set_artists() method will show the Credits button if it is not displayed.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_translator_credits

listitem.simpara: a string containing the translator credits

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_translator_credits() method returns the contents of the "translator-credits" property which contains the credits for the current translation.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_translator_credits

listitem.simpara: a string containing the current translation credits

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_translator_credits() method sets the "translator_credits" property to the value of translator_credits. The translator credits are displayed in the translators tab of the secondary credits dialog.

The intended use for this string is to display the translator of the language which is currently used in the user interface. Using the gettext() function, a simple way to achieve that is to mark the string for translation.

It is a good idea to use the customary msgid "translator-credits" for this purpose, since translators will already know the purpose of that msgid, and since gtk.AboutDialog will detect if "translator-credits" is untranslated and hide the tab.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_logo

listitem.simpara: the gtk.gdk.Pixbuf used as the logo

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_logo() method returns the contents of the "logo" property which contains a gtk.gdk.Pixbuf that is used as the logo.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_logo

listitem.simpara: a gtk.gdk.Pixbuf to be used as the logo

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_logo() method sets the "logo" property to the gtk.gdk.Pixbuf contained in logo. If logo is None, the default window icon set with the gtk.window_set_default_icon_list() function will be used.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.get_logo_icon_name

listitem.simpara: the name of the icon used as the logo

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_logo_name() method returns the contents of the "logo-icon-name" property which contains the name of the icon used as the logo.

refsect2.title: gtk.AboutDialog.set_logo_icon_name

listitem.simpara: the name of an icon or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_logo_icon_name() method sets the "logo-icon-name" property to the value of icon_name. If icon_name is None, the default window icon set with the gtk.window_set_default_icon_list() function will be used.

refsect2.title: gtk.about_dialog_set_email_hook

listitem.simpara: a function to call when an email link is activated.
data to pass to func

note.para: This function is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The gtk.about_dialog_set_email_hook function installs a global function (specified by func) to be called whenever the user activates an email link in an about dialog.
The signature of the callback function func is:
where link is the email address destination of the activated link, dialog is the gtk.AboutDialog containing link and user_data is the data argument passed to gtk.about_dialog_set_email_hook().

refsect2.title: gtk.about_dialog_set_url_hook

listitem.simpara: a function to call when a URL link is activated.
data to pass to func

note.para: This function is available in PyGTK 2.6 and above.

refsect2.para: The gtk.about_dialog_set_url_hook function installs a global function (specified by func) to be called whenever the user activates a URL link in an about dialog.
The signature of the callback function func is:
where link is the URL destination of the activated link, dialog is the gtk.AboutDialog containing link and user_data is the data argument passed to gtk.about_dialog_set_url_hook().

refsect2.title: The "activate-link" gtk.AboutDialog Signal

listitem.simpara: the aboutdialog that received the signal
the URI that is activated
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

note.para: This signal is available in GTK+ 2.24 and above.

refsect2.para: The "activate-link" signal is emitted when an URI is activated. Applications may connect to it to override the default behaviour, which is to call gtk.show_uri().
